headline: Visa and American Express Results Point to a Strong Holiday Season for Retailers
summary: Credit-card issuers have an uplifting message for investors ahead of retailers’ earnings report: Consumer spending held up well in the last quarter of 2025, and continues to grow at a healthy clip.  Both  Visa  and American Express flagged resilient shopping in their latest quarterly earnings.  Visa reported results Thursday afternoon, while  Amex’s  results were released Friday morning.

headline: Visa Deepens Digital Payment Role With Stablecoins Rent And Crypto Flows
summary: Visa expanded its stablecoin settlement capabilities, aiming to support more blockchain based payment flows across its network. The company partnered with Amenify to build a resident commerce and rewards program focused on renters and housing related spending. Visa also teamed up with Mercuryo to offer a global crypto to fiat off ramp using Visa Direct for faster withdrawal to cards and bank accounts. Visa (NYSE: V) is leaning further into digital payments at a time when its core card...

headline: American Express Falls After Earnings. The Stock Is Having a Rocky Start to 2026.
summary: Shares of  American Express  dropped Friday after the credit-card giant’s quarterly earnings slightly missed analysts’ estimates and its 2026 outlook met expectations.  American Express stock fell 2.7% Friday.  President Donald Trump’s call to cap credit-card interest rates at 10% for one year hasn’t helped, though that policy may have a more muted impact on American Express’ generally high-credit clientele.
